title: Dozens of migrants missing in latest Tunisia shipwreck
description: The boat carrying 38 people had set off Thursday from near Sfax and was attempting to reach Italy. It is the latest in a string of tragedies this month.

title: Mbappe shines as France captain in 4-0 win over the Netherlands
description: Leading a new era for Les Bleus, Mbappe slotted home two unforgiving finishes to headline win over a depleted Netherlands side in Euro 2024 qualifying on Friday.

title: US and Canada reach new migration deal to limit asylum claims
description: The new policy says that any asylum seekers who lack US or Canadian citizenship and are caught within 14 days of crossing will be sent back across the border.

title: Macron and Ursula von der Leyen will visit China to urge peace in Ukraine
description: The French president said after a summit of EU leaders in Brussels that he had asked the EU Chief to come with him for part of the trip to present a 'united voice' to President Xi Jinping and China.

title: Algeria's ambassador to France will return to post after diplomatic spat
description: Ambassador Said Moussi was recalled home in February after a well-known Algerian militant was whisked to France from Tunisia with the help of French diplomats.

title: Council of Europe slams 'excessive use of force' by French police in protests
description: The continent's leading human rights watchdog is joined by rights groups, magistrates and left-wing politicians condemning actions by law enforcement at demonstrations against the country's pension reform.

title: French police caught on tape during protest arrest: 'I can tell you, we have broken elbows and faces'
description: In an audio recording obtained by 'Le Monde', several police officers threaten young people arrested during a protest against the government's pension reform. One young man was struck twice.

title: Biden's friendship with Israel continues to be tested
description: The White House cannot afford to merely level formal criticism at the Jewish state as Israel remains America's closest, most reliable and most essential Middle Eastern ally.

title: The right to asylum, everywhere in France
description: Elected officials who defend the reception of asylum seekers or refugees, such as the mayor of Saint-Brevin-les-Pins, whose home was targeted by arson, must be protected. The fears that extremists put forward need to be studied and debunked.

title: Le Pen displeased by party official's inauguration of a mosque
description: Joris Hébrard, an MP for the far-right  Rassemblement National, inaugurated the place of worship alongside Turkish religious representatives in France, irking his party leader

title: Tunisia: 'Chaima Issa defends the work on public liberties accomplished by the revolution'
description: French-Tunisian writer Hélé Béji reacts to the arrest on February 23 of Chaima Issa, a member of the National Salvation Front, which brings together opponents of the coup led by Tunisian President Kais Saied.

title: 'Hotel Rwanda' hero's jail sentence commuted
description: Paul Rusesabagina, an outspoken critic of President Paul Kagame whose story insipred the 2004 film on the Rwandan genocide, is set to be released.

title: In Georgia, Russia and the European Union vie for influence
description: The controversy surrounding the bill on 'foreign agents' has exposed a tug-of-war between Brussels and Moscow in the Caucasian country, exacerbated by the war in Ukraine.

title: France bans TikTok from public employee work phones
description: This ban on 'recreational applications' follows similar ones in other European countries as well as in the United States, Canada and Australia.

title: India's Rahul Gandhi expelled from parliament after conviction for defaming Modi
description: The Indian opposition leader has been accused of implying the prime minister was a criminal in a remark he made in 2019.

title: French pension reform: Day of anger gives way to night of turmoil
description: Opponents of the reform adopted without a vote in the Assemblée Nationale demonstrated across France on Thursday. The protests were accompanied by a surge in anger and violence.

title: French PM Borne's fate fuels divisions among Macron allies
description: The president has tasked his prime minister with forming a wider government coalition by attracting new members as the anger over a pension reform shows no signs of abating.

title: King Charles' state visit to France postponed amid mass pension strikes and protests
description: The British monarch was set to arrive in France on Sunday for three days. But the ongoing turmoil raised the possibility of disruptions and some feared that a lavish state dinner in Versailles would only make protestors angrier.

title: French pension protests: 457 arrested and 441 police injured on Thursday, minister reports
description: The latest day of national strikes was the most violent so far, days after the reform was officially adopted without a vote in the Assemblée Nationale.

title: Uber Files: Whistleblower denounces France's 'systemic failures' on lobbying
description: Mark MacGann, the former Uber employee behind the revelations made by 'Le Monde' and its partners, was heard by a French parliamentary investigative committee.

title: Bulgaria's Rose Valley hides a well-kept secret: The weapons it delivers to Ukraine
description: In a country where the pro-Russian movement is strong, arms factories are running at full speed, but are discreet about their deliveries to Kyiv.

title: Drone strike in Syria kills American contractor
description: The United States retaliated with airstrikes against facilities in eastern Syria used by groups affiliated with Iran's Revolutionary Guard.

title: Claude Lorius, a pioneer of glaciology and the science of global warming, has died
description: The researcher was the first to demonstrate the influence of greenhouse gases on global warming, in the mid 1960s. He died on March 21, at the age of 91.

title: Buenos Aires struggles cleaning up the most polluted river in Argentina
description: The launch of a new sanitation system in 2023 should relieve the river of its main source of pollution. Until then, the river remains an open sewer.

title: 'Artificial intelligence already has the same problems as social media'
description: ChatGPT and its rivals are accused of being 'woke', but also of creating dangerous content, notes 'Le Monde' columnist Alexandre Piquard.

title: US lawmakers grill TikTok CEO over data security and Chinese connections
description: TikTok CEO Shou Zi Chew faced relentless questioning from combative US lawmakers on both sides of the political aisle Thursday over the video-sharing app's alleged ties to China and its danger to teens.

title: US court blocks Biden's Covid-19 vaccine mandate for federal employees
description: Biden issued an executive order in September 2021 requiring vaccinations for all executive branch agency employees, with exceptions for medical and religious reasons.
